title: Trump issued a flurry of executive orders: See a list of highlights
shortDescription: Donald's Trump first day in office on Monday was marked by a huge list of executive orders. See some of the most talked about highlights.

title: What is birthright citizenship? Trump wants to end it
shortDescription: After the Civil War, the Constitution was amended to consider every baby born in the US an American. Soon that may change.

title: President Trump attends National Prayer Service
shortDescription: President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance attend the National Prayer Service at Washington National Cathedral on Jan. 21, 2025.

title: Judge continues to block report on Trump's classified documents case
shortDescription: A federal judge blocked the release of Jack Smith's report on Donald Trump's classified documents case because his co-defendants face a possible trial

title: What does the cryptocurrency market look like under Trump 2.0?
shortDescription: Bitcoin passed the $100,000 mark for the first time just last December. Could this be the year crypto goes mainstream?

title: Trump to begin second term as Inauguration Day arrives | The Excerpt
shortDescription: Plus: What Donald Trump plans as part of his first 100 executive actions in his second term. | A ceasefire has begun between Israel and Hamas.

title: Trump returns to the White House | The Excerpt
shortDescription: Plus: Trump's new meme coin soars. | Trump's executive orders surrounding January 6 pardons, and the southern border. | It's all on The Excerpt.

title: Biden continues presidential tradition with letter to Trump
shortDescription: "Maybe we should all read it together," Trump told reporters upon finding Biden's letter. "Maybe I'll read it first and then make that determination."

title: Jan. 6 prisoners including Stewart Rhodes free after Trump pardons, commutations
shortDescription: Stewart Rhodes, the former head of the Oath Keepers militia, was among Jan. 6 inmates freed under President Trump's pardons and commutations.

title: Trump warns steep tariffs are on the way for Canada and Mexico
shortDescription: President Donald Trump told reporters hours after taking office that he was considering levying a blanket duty on Mexico and Canada on Feb. 1.

title: Trump dances inauguration night away
shortDescription: President Donald Trump danced on stage with First Lady Melania Trump at three inaugural balls.

title: Trump stays off script at first Oval Office press conference
shortDescription: President Trump was eager on Monday to point out contrasts with his Democratic predecessor, including a free-wheeling Oval Office press conference.

title: ACLU files lawsuit against Trump order to end birthright citizenship
shortDescription: Eighteen states and the ACLU filed lawsuits seeking to prevent President Trump from denying citizenship to children born in the U.S. to non-citizens.

title: Donald Trump kicks off first full day in office: Live updates
shortDescription: Tuesday marks Donald Trump's first full day in office. Keep up with the USA TODAY Network's live coverage on his top priorities for Americans.

title: President Trump signs flurry of executive orders
shortDescription: President Donald Trump signed a flurry of executive orders from the Oval Office addressing a wide range of topics.

title: Daily Briefing: Trump's first full day in office
shortDescription: The 47th president didn't miss a beat in getting his government up and running. Here is the news to know on Tuesday.

title: Donald Trump followed inauguration with flurry of action. Now what?
shortDescription: The 47th president issued a series of executive orders, saw his first Cabinet member confirmed and moved into the White House, all in a day's work.

title: Why does Trump want to change the 14th Amendment and US citizenship?
shortDescription: The 14th Amendment grants citizenship to "all persons born or naturalized in the US"—why does Trump wants to change it?

title: President Trump orders United States to exit WHO
shortDescription: The day-one executive order fulfills a campaign promise. Health experts worry it puts US health at risk.

title: Trump issues executive order to halt TikTok ban – but is it legal?
shortDescription: President Donald Trump issued an executive order aiming to temporarily halt a law requiring TikTok to sell U.S. assets or be banned in the U.S.

title: Trump pardons nearly 1,600 Jan. 6 defendants, a campaign promise
shortDescription: Nearly 1,600 people were charged and about 1,270 people were convicted in the riot.

title: President Trump takes a spin at three inaugural balls
shortDescription: President Donald Trump stopped by the Commander in Chief Ball, Liberty Ball and Starlight Ball, dancing to the same song at each of inaugural gala.

title: Donald Trump's 47th presidency in pictures
shortDescription: Donald Trump was sworn in as the 47th President of the United States on Jan. 20, 2025.

title: Video shows Donald Trump take presidential oath for second time
shortDescription: Trump was sworn back into the White House as the 47th U.S. president Monday at an inauguration ceremony held inside the Rotunda of the U.S. Capitol.
